first_para: Gregory Thomas Mulholland (born 31 August 1970) is a Liberal Democrat politician in the United Kingdom, and was the Member of Parliament for Leeds North West until the dissolution of parliament on 30 March 2015, prior to the 2015 general election. He was first elected at the 2005 general election, winning the seat from Labour and was re-elected with an increased majority at the 2010 general election. Before his parliamentary career, he served as a councillor for Headingley. He has served as a Liberal Democrat spokesman for Health, Schools and International Development.

full.extract: Gregory Thomas Mulholland (born 31 August 1970) is a Liberal Democrat politician in the United Kingdom, and was the Member of Parliament for Leeds North West until the dissolution of parliament on 30 March 2015, prior to the 2015 general election. He was first elected at the 2005 general election, winning the seat from Labour and was re-elected with an increased majority at the 2010 general election. Before his parliamentary career, he served as a councillor for Headingley. He has served as a Liberal Democrat spokesman for Health, Schools and International Development.
full.title: Greg Mulholland
